By Unpleasant Desire on Sunday, April 7, 2002 - 07:14 am:

Thanks Anonymous, I manage to get my hands on 3 different LadySmith Black Mambazo Cd's but not that one.... Now I know the title, I will try and get a hold of that one. Well one thing that makes it harder for PAL users is that since PAL format is available for many different countries, we not only have to deal with different pressing but other changes for CD's when produced in different countries such as bonus tracks or remastered CD's. So dont feel bad for me, I have no idea how many Cd's I've shrined. But you know it comes with playing the game but like I've said before, it can become quite tedious.

By Mr.Bean123 on Sunday, April 7, 2002 - 09:14 am:

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, April 24, 2002 - 08:19 pm:

By Mr.Bean123 on Friday, May 3, 2002 - 10:27 am:

Do pressings take into account with shrining over in the PAL regions? How about scratches?

By Unpleasant Desire on Friday, May 3, 2002 - 03:32 pm:

From what I know I am not sure. Since I am in Australia and PAL is available here as well as in the UK and other places, I cannot verify if that is true. Because some CD's may have the same Distributor or label, they probably are made in totally different countries and there are of not of the same pressing plus some CD's when release in other countries may have something added done to them whether it be bonus tracks, digitally remastered or some other feature which really just creates even more havoc when looking for a certain CD.

About scratches, I'm not sure about that either. Some people over at MR.com claim to have gotten other monsters from scratch CD's but I've never experienced anything like this before except on 1 occassion where a CD was unreadable which gave me a striped shell, but when I tried again it gave an Antares. But I think it happened cause it was lightly scratched and it was during a session of mass shrining.

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, August 14, 2004 - 07:27 pm:

You also need to spcify what country the music CDs were pressed in. We have had problems with UK pressings vs AU pressings, meaning that we have a lot of angry AU users whose CDs do not work. UD pretty much posted his own discs without revealing any pressing info.
